intro: Couepia janzenii, commonly known as the Janzen's couepia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly in Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its native range.
